posts.title: Trump invokes 18th century law to declare invasion by gangs and speed deportations
top_comments:
>Trump invokes 18th century law to speed deportations, judge stalls it hours later

Not sure if AP updated the headline after the initial post, but this is what the headline says now

It was just broadly blocked by a judge, including the instruction to turn around planes in the air. We'll see if the administration obeys. https://bsky.app/profile/kyledcheney.bsky.social/post/3lkh7pb7zb226

This is what we used to lock Japanese citizens, Germans, Italians.. Etc. During WW2.


The main concerns are as follows:

Presumption of Membership – The order assumes that membership in TdA makes someone an "Alien Enemy," but it does not specify how membership is determined. Accusations alone could lead to detention and deportation.

Lack of Due Process – The Alien Enemies Act does not require the government to prove an individual’s involvement in criminal activity before deportation. Historically, this law has been applied broadly during wartime with minimal legal recourse.

Citizenship Risks – While the order officially applies to non-citizen Venezuelans, enforcement errors, profiling, and lack of oversight could easily result in U.S. citizens being detained if accused of association with TdA.

Political Weaponization – The vague criteria and emergency framing could enable selective enforcement, disproportionately targeting certain immigrant communities or political opponents.


I'm as white bread as they come, born in Nebraska. Under the statute as written, if someone really had it in for me.... Could accuse *me* of being part of TdA... And I won't even get the chance to say adios before I'm shipped to wherever the hell they decide to send me. (this is an extremely unlikely scenario, but the fact it isn't strictly hyperbole should be chilling.)

"There must be in-groups whom the law protects but does not bind, alongside out-groups whom the law binds but does not protect."

I'm continually amazed at how perfectly a random blogger named Frank Wilhoit summed up the essence of the MAGA m.o.
This is insane,Martial law is coming next.

“We were American citizens. We were incarcerated by our American government in American internment camps here in the United States. The term ‘Japanese internment camp’ is both grammatically and factually incorrect.” - George Takei
He can literally target ANYONE now.  All that’s required is the accusation.

It is a wartime law, and thus needs actual war to be occurring. 

Which is why a judge has already halted it. 

… either Trump didn’t know it was only allowed during war - in which case he is INCREDIBLY incompetent. 

… OR, he did know that, and wanted to illegally enact wartime powers outside of war. I wonder where we’ve seen that before …

From Article:

The White House is preparing to move about 300 people it identifies as members of the gang to detention in El Salvador.

*We’ll (possibly) be facing a martial law situation because they identified 300 “gang members” to deport*…wow.

The law only applies to times of war, only used three times: 

The War of 1812, 
WWI and WWII. 

The law itself states that cannot be enacted in peacetime. 

Of course, who knows what this idiot can get away with?

posts.title: Teacher ordered to remove signs from classroom, including one saying 'Everyone is welcome here'
top_comments: She should call them out on it: "Provide a list of who isn't welcome, and I'll consider amending the sign"

>An Idaho teacher is in a standoff with her own school district after officials ordered her to remove classroom signs, including one that reads, “Everyone is welcome here.” 

>Sarah Inama, a sixth-grade history teacher at Lewis and Clark Middle School in Meridian, Idaho, says she won’t comply with the order, arguing that the message is a fundamental part to ensuring a positive learning environment for her students.

>Inama, who has taught at the school for five years, says her commitment to inclusivity isn’t about politics. It’s about her passion for education and students.

>“I love the area that I teach,” she says in an interview with TODAY.com. “It’s really a valuable thing for people to know our human history, things that humans have accomplished, our time on this earth, things that they’ve overcome, patterns that exist.”

>Five years ago, when she first put up the two signs, it was to make sure students knew they were in an open and welcoming space. Now, she says she is risking her job in the name of those values.

>Inama says the controversy began in January when her principal and vice principal came to her classroom to inform her that two posters on her walls were controversial and needed to be removed, a detail the district verified in an email to TODAY.com. Inama says other teachers were given similar instruction, but she was caught off guard by the directive.

Good for her for refusing to back down from the "controversial" view that *Everyone is welcome here.*

Her decorations seem pretty benign and somewhat “content-neutral”

I guess it’s now controversial and innapropriate to state that all people are equal? Administration should clearly define why the given decoration goes against their policy in detail…
those officials are such grim people. it speaks to the wider regime in the current day but for this instance, I would jot what my kids in that district

Take the sign down. Bring it to the next school board meeting. Lay it down on the table in front of them, and then calmly and simply ask, “Please point to the hands that are not welcome here.”

Don’t leave until each board member gets a chance to participate.
Change it to “everyone but Nazis” and see if that works better.

There is zero defensible position with the school district's mandate. The teacher's sign only echoes their official policy of inclusion and respect, so either they're lying (they don't actually believe everyone deserves respect and/or inclusion), or they're just suppressing individual speech. There's zero wiggle room here.


My opinion? My guess is they're lying. We know very well that Jim Crow, segregation, and the KKK were the official responses to emancipation. They were legislated into the closet, forced to use dog whistles. Now they're getting comfy and coming back out.


"Red and yellow, black and white, they are precious in his sight. Jesus loves the little children of the world." Haven't heard this song since my childhood, seems about time to revive it. You have to fight these kooks with their own values.

They're acting like this a big deal, but letting her stay the rest of the school year - they know they're wrong and they just need a teacher in that classroom. She is right to stand up to them and keep her sign, it's a beautiful message.

https://www.westada.org/o/lcms/page/contact-us
I am proud of this teacher.

posts.title: Long Island man is first in New York history to be cured of sickle cell anemia
top_comments:
Ok, so being a biology and medicine geek, this is super interesting, not to mention an incredible moment for humanity. But I was confused reading the article why they called this a cure. Before I read it I assumed CRISPR or a similar gene therapy would had been used. I was correct, but the article really didn't mention that. 

Here's the technology they used. 


"Lyfgenia is a personalized gene therapy that uses the patient's own blood-forming stem cells. These cells are modified in the laboratory to contain a healthy copy of the beta-globin gene, which is responsible for producing sickle hemoglobin. The modified cells are then infused back into the patient, where they establish themselves in the bone marrow and produce healthy hemoglobin. This helps to reduce or eliminate the production of sickle hemoglobin, which is the underlying cause of SCD."

This is why medical research should be funded

but we know how that’s going
Sickle cell is fucking awful and this is amazing. I hope this treatment becomes widely available. And by “available” I mean actually available both physically and financially.
Finally some good news. I’m sick of the doom and gloom

The article title is kind of mostly false.

He’s the first to be cured with gene therapy. I don’t know, but I’m pretty sure that someone with sickle cell disease has gotten a bone marrow transplant in New York before. The only article I can find is a [Rochester woman](https://www.wxxinews.org/local-news/2024-11-14/bone-marrow-transplant-gives-rochester-woman-with-sickle-cell-a-new-life), so technically he still might be the first man.
Now this is the kind of news we should be hearing about!
Actually made me cry. Meeting young kids with this while working in a hospital was devastating. Now there’s hope for them.
now that is some good news
Finally, a positive news article! This is huge!
Amazing, let's see more of this

posts.title: Investigation: We tried to buy American chips as a Russian defense manufacturer — and it worked
top_comments:
Tl;dr Ukrainian reporters successfully bought US chips from a Russian company sourced from China.

Many US companies outsource their chip manufacturing to China. These companies ship the chips to distributors that in turn sell them to Russia. These chips are used in Russian missiles and drones.

“If you’re Texas Instruments or Intel, you have large distributors. The distributors sell components to all sorts of entities all over the world. Let’s say you sell to some distributor in Hong Kong, and then they sell to another entity in Hong Kong, and that entity ships them to the Russians. I think it’s a difficult problem to solve, but it doesn’t mean it’s impossible.”

When there is a growing war concern and the currency markets are in disarray, history has shown that many investors trade local currency for gold, first for stability, and second...when many investors are doing that, the price of gold typically goes up.


When the Russians invaded Afghanistan, the price of gold actually went down...so why?


President Carter employed trade bans, one of which was a ban on selling US wheat to Russia, because that years Russian harvest was weak, and Carter hoped it would have some effect with negotiations.


Russia decided to have Argentina buy huge orders of US wheat, then the cargoships actually went to Russia, with Argentina marking up the trade maybe 20%


The problem was that...Russia did not trade in Rubles, and had no way to pay for it. They ended up paying from their gold reserve, and the fresh flood of gold lowered prices.
Arms dealers buy from and sell to anyone.  Silicon is just a component of arms.
Or they buy boatload of gaming consoles.
It took me longer than I'd care to admit that they were not talking about potato chips.
To capitalists a sale is a sale.
I'm old enough to remember when they didn't want Iran to buy PS2s

Unless the chips are restricted because of dual-use etc, it's probably not illegal. I couldn't find anything in the article as to what the chips were, I'm guessing something more technical than a 555.
Fraud, waste, abuse and treason
This world will burn rather sooner than later because of human greed and indifference.

posts.title: Arlington Cemetery strips content on black and female veterans from website
top_comments: they even removed all mention of general colin powell, the first black man to become chairman of the joint chiefs of staff and is buried there!
What does this accomplish?
I guess nobody is processing that it cost more money to remove shit like this than, you know, averting your fking eyes.
Will that make groceries cheaper or should I wait until tomorrow?
Will Arlington now start digging up non-white and non-male graves?

#Vanishing History: Arlington Cemetery Erases Stories of Black and Female Veterans

Something strange is happening at Arlington National Cemetery. The sprawling burial ground, where hundreds of thousands of American veterans rest, has quietly erased large chunks of its history from public view. Information about black, Hispanic and female service members, once readily available on its website, has vanished. The pages once told the stories of men and women who broke barriers and gave their all for a country that did not always give back. Now, with a few clicks, they are simply gone.

The move is part of President Donald Trump's sweeping effort to rid the US military and federal government of diversity, equity and inclusion policies. His administration has been swift in shutting down initiatives that highlight the contributions of minority groups, and Arlington has not been spared.

Visitors looking for details about notable graves have run into dead ends. The pages once dedicated to figures such as General Colin Powell, the first black chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and the legendary Tuskegee Airmen, the country's first black military pilots, have disappeared. The same goes for Hector Santa Anna, a World War II hero and decorated bomber pilot. Even broader categories of history have been stripped away. Sections on African American, Hispanic and Women's history are no longer easily accessible from the main site.

Officially, Arlington insists it is working to restore some of the missing content, though it also says it wants to ensure everything aligns with Trump's executive orders and the policies of Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth. Hegseth, a former Fox News host and military veteran, has been vocal about his desire to root out what he calls “woke” culture from the armed forces. He was instrumental in removing General CQ Brown, the first black chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who had supported diversity efforts.

The backlash has already begun. Representative Adam Smith, a senior Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, called the situation “deeply concerning” and suggested there was never a problem with diversity in the military to begin with. Earlier this year, a similar attempt to remove training materials on the Tuskegee Airmen sparked national outrage, forcing the Pentagon to reverse course.

The US military today is a complex institution, with more than two million people serving in active duty or reserves. A significant portion of them come from minority backgrounds. Thirty per cent identify as black, Native American or other underrepresented groups, while nearly one-fifth are women. The stories now missing from Arlington's website belong to people who paved the way for them.

History cannot be deleted as easily as a webpage. The soldiers buried at Arlington, no matter their background, are not just names etched into headstones. They were real people who lived, fought and sacrificed. Whether or not their stories remain in an online archive, their contributions cannot be erased. But the question remains, why is their history being buried once again?

Elect white supremacists, and they're gonna do shit like this. 

This is just the beginning.
And the MAGA folks get so personally offended when you point out that bigotry and racism are defining characteristics of their movement... \*facepalm\*
Just like bigoted American Jesus intended.
Dishonouring the dead this way is a new low even for them. These people fought and died for their country.

posts.title: Los Angeles man awarded $50 million in case against Starbucks after suffering permanent injury from spilled tea
top_comments:
>Starbucks had initially offered $3 million to Garcia pre-trial, later upping that amount to $30 million to settle. Garcia agreed, but under the condition that they apologize, change their policies and issue a memo to all store locations to double-check their hot drinks before handing them to customers, attorneys said. 

>When they declined to agree to those terms, the jury eventually decided to award Garcia with Friday's total. 

Shame the judge didn't also order Starbucks to comply with those terms instead of just letting them pay to get out of it.
At least this headline included “permanent injury” so people can’t jump to conclusions about the win being undeserved.
Starbucks is so entrenched in corporate culture that instead of saying sorry and agreeing to double check the lids are secure they declined a lesser amount and now have to pay 20 million more.

"Hey, I've seen this one before"
"What are you talking about? It's brand new"

> The spill left Garcia was life-changing injuries. He suffered third degree burns, nerve damage and permanent injury to his genitals. Lawyers say that he's already had multiple surgeries and that he still experiences pain every day. On top of this, they say that he suffers from severe PTSD. 

Just like that poor McDonald’s lady whose labia literally fused together from the hot coffee. 

And just think of all the plastic cup lining that’s melting in the drink from being that hot.

Starbucks had initially offered $3 million to Garcia pre-trial, later upping that amount to $30 million to settle. Garcia agreed, but under the condition that they apologize, change their policies and issue a memo to all store locations to double-check their hot drinks before handing them to customers, attorneys said. 

So the redline was an apology and a memo?

Good for him. You’re in the drive through trying to get a drink when an incredibly hot tea with an unsecured lid gets dumped in your lap causing 3rd degree burns, nerve damage, and permanent genital injuries…

Then they play this game:
“Starbucks says if our hands are off the drink, then no matter what happens, we’re not responsible,” said Garcia’s trial attorney Nicholas Rowley. “So, if I’m Starbucks and I hand you a drink that doesn’t have a lid that’s secured, and it’s a scalding hot 180 degree drink, or if I hand you a drink that’s in a container and it’s loose and it’s not secured, and it falls right on you — the moment that I take my hands off of it, then you’re responsible and I, the corporation, am not.”

He had accepted $30 million + apology and ensuring lids are secure and they declined. Now they pay $50 million.
Didn’t they learn this lesson after it happened to McDonald’s, years ago?  There’s no reason coffee/tea should ever be kept that hot.
I’m assuming it was spilled in his lap, the tea was probably very hot, and his lap doesn’t work anymore.

normally I disagree with awarding huge sums like this but when you're just trying to order some coffee and your genitals get destroyed, i feel bad for the guy. no money in the world can make up for the mental trauma of have a disfigured penis! will cause emotional issues for the rest of his life.

posts.title: New contraceptive pill, endometriosis treatment and IVF drug to become cheaper with women's health funding
top_comments: In an ABC news article??? Oh, an ABC.AU article.  That makes more sense.

You almost made me hopeful for the U.S.  

My wife and I had to do IVF for our first (born last Summer) since I’m sterile. It cost over $30K even with insurance (though I think part of that included a failed sperm retrieval from me as well as buying donor sperm). 

As much as I’m looking forward to number two, I dread how much this go around will be.
This is what happens in those horrible evil socialist health systems that non-U.S. countries flagrantly indulge in. /s

Annoyingly, Reddit AI flared this as “US News”. 

It’s Australian

Australia is also working on adding more ADHD drugs to the PBS for patients diagnosed in adulthood. Those patients can currently only access Dex, Vyvanse and Ritalin LA on PBS, with no non-stimulant options - even if stimulants are contraindicated for them. Dex has been a very recent addition. 

It reflects the old idea that ADHD can only be diagnosed in childhood and ignores the fact that it’s possible for a diagnosis to be overlooked - mine was put down to anxiety and similar things for decades. It means many adults who cannot use stimulants end up relying on the antihypertensive clonidine, which is still helpful but not as suitable as actual ADHD non-stimulants. 

Many of these drugs are not exorbitantly priced, but putting them on PBS helps people with disabilities, a group with more challenges to employment and earning potential, afford the medication they need to function more.
i clicked on the story skeptical….and i was right. not the US. but i am happy for you aussie ladies.
Shhhh. They'll hear you.
Rigggghhhtt. What funding? Don’t anyone hold their breath in this political climate.

posts.title: Live: SpaceX Crew-10 mission docks with the International Space Station to relieve stranded astronauts
top_comments:
The press and politicians have been storytelling the crap out of this. This is what facts sound like when you don't do that:

Butch and Suni arrived to the ISS with the Starliner CFT mission in June, 2024. It was then decided that due to the issues with Starliner, they shouldn't return on that spacecraft. Starliner undocked on September 6th and returned to Earth safely. SpaceX Crew-9 docked on September 29th. Butch and Suni did not have dedicated seats for an emergency return between September 6th and 29th. In the event of an emergency, requiring the evacuation of the ISS, they would have returned on Crew-8, strapped to a cargo pallette in the Crew Dragon spacecraft. As mentioned before, Crew-9 docked on September 29th, carrying a crew of only two instead of four, hence giving Butch and Suni dedicated seats and duties as crew on that mission with a planned return to Earth in February, 2025. In the event of an emergency, Crew-9 could have returned any time. The planned return in February, 2025 had to be delayed to likely late April, 2025, as SpaceX was unable to complete the new Dragon C213 spacecraft for the Crew-10 mission in time. A direct handover between crew is a high priority, so Crew-10's launch delay would also delay Crew-9's return. Crew-10 launched yesterday, with less delays than initially expected, due to the fact that the Dragon spacecraft was swappped to C210. Crew-10 will be on the ISS for around 6 months. Crew-9 is now scheduled to return no earlier than March 19th.

I really REALLY wish that this politicized "stranded" storyline was not repeated so often.

They have not at any time been "stranded".  
When it was shown that there were issues with Starliner, the two were consulted and both they and Nasa decided to change the crew rotation in such a way that they got to spend extra time on station.  
They were never stranded, they have been part of an extended crew stay that is now coming to it's preconceived end.

This was in no way a 'rescue mission' just as much as they were never 'stranded'.

The truth matters, despite people not agreeing these days.

They aren't stranded, their ride home arrived back in September with 2 astronauts onboard. The same spacecraft will depart in a week or so with 4 astronauts aboard and thus keeping the expedition crew sizes at normal levels to keep the station properly and fully manned.

posts.title: Trump invokes 18th century law to declare invasion by gangs and speed deportations
top_comments:
>Trump invokes 18th century law to speed deportations, judge stalls it hours later

Not sure if AP updated the headline after the initial post, but this is what the headline says now

It was just broadly blocked by a judge, including the instruction to turn around planes in the air. We'll see if the administration obeys. https://bsky.app/profile/kyledcheney.bsky.social/post/3lkh7pb7zb226

This is what we used to lock Japanese citizens, Germans, Italians.. Etc. During WW2.


The main concerns are as follows:

Presumption of Membership – The order assumes that membership in TdA makes someone an "Alien Enemy," but it does not specify how membership is determined. Accusations alone could lead to detention and deportation.

Lack of Due Process – The Alien Enemies Act does not require the government to prove an individual’s involvement in criminal activity before deportation. Historically, this law has been applied broadly during wartime with minimal legal recourse.

Citizenship Risks – While the order officially applies to non-citizen Venezuelans, enforcement errors, profiling, and lack of oversight could easily result in U.S. citizens being detained if accused of association with TdA.

Political Weaponization – The vague criteria and emergency framing could enable selective enforcement, disproportionately targeting certain immigrant communities or political opponents.


I'm as white bread as they come, born in Nebraska. Under the statute as written, if someone really had it in for me.... Could accuse *me* of being part of TdA... And I won't even get the chance to say adios before I'm shipped to wherever the hell they decide to send me. (this is an extremely unlikely scenario, but the fact it isn't strictly hyperbole should be chilling.)

"There must be in-groups whom the law protects but does not bind, alongside out-groups whom the law binds but does not protect."

I'm continually amazed at how perfectly a random blogger named Frank Wilhoit summed up the essence of the MAGA m.o.
This is insane,Martial law is coming next.

“We were American citizens. We were incarcerated by our American government in American internment camps here in the United States. The term ‘Japanese internment camp’ is both grammatically and factually incorrect.” - George Takei
He can literally target ANYONE now.  All that’s required is the accusation.

It is a wartime law, and thus needs actual war to be occurring. 

Which is why a judge has already halted it. 

… either Trump didn’t know it was only allowed during war - in which case he is INCREDIBLY incompetent. 

… OR, he did know that, and wanted to illegally enact wartime powers outside of war. I wonder where we’ve seen that before …

From Article:

The White House is preparing to move about 300 people it identifies as members of the gang to detention in El Salvador.

*We’ll (possibly) be facing a martial law situation because they identified 300 “gang members” to deport*…wow.

The law only applies to times of war, only used three times: 

The War of 1812, 
WWI and WWII. 

The law itself states that cannot be enacted in peacetime. 

Of course, who knows what this idiot can get away with?

posts.title: New contraceptive pill, endometriosis treatment and IVF drug to become cheaper with women's health funding
top_comments: In an ABC news article??? Oh, an ABC.AU article.  That makes more sense.

You almost made me hopeful for the U.S.  

My wife and I had to do IVF for our first (born last Summer) since I’m sterile. It cost over $30K even with insurance (though I think part of that included a failed sperm retrieval from me as well as buying donor sperm). 

As much as I’m looking forward to number two, I dread how much this go around will be.
This is what happens in those horrible evil socialist health systems that non-U.S. countries flagrantly indulge in. /s

Annoyingly, Reddit AI flared this as “US News”. 

It’s Australian

Australia is also working on adding more ADHD drugs to the PBS for patients diagnosed in adulthood. Those patients can currently only access Dex, Vyvanse and Ritalin LA on PBS, with no non-stimulant options - even if stimulants are contraindicated for them. Dex has been a very recent addition. 

It reflects the old idea that ADHD can only be diagnosed in childhood and ignores the fact that it’s possible for a diagnosis to be overlooked - mine was put down to anxiety and similar things for decades. It means many adults who cannot use stimulants end up relying on the antihypertensive clonidine, which is still helpful but not as suitable as actual ADHD non-stimulants. 

Many of these drugs are not exorbitantly priced, but putting them on PBS helps people with disabilities, a group with more challenges to employment and earning potential, afford the medication they need to function more.
i clicked on the story skeptical….and i was right. not the US. but i am happy for you aussie ladies.
Shhhh. They'll hear you.
Rigggghhhtt. What funding? Don’t anyone hold their breath in this political climate.

top_comments:

>The ranch in Teuchitlan, about 37 miles west of Guadalajara was allegedly being used as a training base for cartel recruits when National Guard troops found it last September.

>Authorities then said 10 people were arrested, two hostages were freed and a body was found wrapped in plastic. The state prosecutor's office went in with a backhoe, dogs and devices to find inconsistencies in the ground.

>But then the investigation went quiet until members of the Jalisco Search Warriors, one of dozens of search collectives that dot Mexico, visited the site last week on a tip.

Amazing how civilians with basic tools can find what the Mexican police missed (aka purposefully overlooked because they were already in the cartel's pocket).

posts.title: Teacher ordered to remove signs from classroom, including one saying 'Everyone is welcome here'
top_comments: She should call them out on it: "Provide a list of who isn't welcome, and I'll consider amending the sign"

>An Idaho teacher is in a standoff with her own school district after officials ordered her to remove classroom signs, including one that reads, “Everyone is welcome here.” 

>Sarah Inama, a sixth-grade history teacher at Lewis and Clark Middle School in Meridian, Idaho, says she won’t comply with the order, arguing that the message is a fundamental part to ensuring a positive learning environment for her students.

>Inama, who has taught at the school for five years, says her commitment to inclusivity isn’t about politics. It’s about her passion for education and students.

>“I love the area that I teach,” she says in an interview with TODAY.com. “It’s really a valuable thing for people to know our human history, things that humans have accomplished, our time on this earth, things that they’ve overcome, patterns that exist.”

>Five years ago, when she first put up the two signs, it was to make sure students knew they were in an open and welcoming space. Now, she says she is risking her job in the name of those values.

>Inama says the controversy began in January when her principal and vice principal came to her classroom to inform her that two posters on her walls were controversial and needed to be removed, a detail the district verified in an email to TODAY.com. Inama says other teachers were given similar instruction, but she was caught off guard by the directive.

Good for her for refusing to back down from the "controversial" view that *Everyone is welcome here.*

Her decorations seem pretty benign and somewhat “content-neutral”

I guess it’s now controversial and innapropriate to state that all people are equal? Administration should clearly define why the given decoration goes against their policy in detail…
those officials are such grim people. it speaks to the wider regime in the current day but for this instance, I would jot what my kids in that district

Take the sign down. Bring it to the next school board meeting. Lay it down on the table in front of them, and then calmly and simply ask, “Please point to the hands that are not welcome here.”

Don’t leave until each board member gets a chance to participate.
Change it to “everyone but Nazis” and see if that works better.

There is zero defensible position with the school district's mandate. The teacher's sign only echoes their official policy of inclusion and respect, so either they're lying (they don't actually believe everyone deserves respect and/or inclusion), or they're just suppressing individual speech. There's zero wiggle room here.


My opinion? My guess is they're lying. We know very well that Jim Crow, segregation, and the KKK were the official responses to emancipation. They were legislated into the closet, forced to use dog whistles. Now they're getting comfy and coming back out.


"Red and yellow, black and white, they are precious in his sight. Jesus loves the little children of the world." Haven't heard this song since my childhood, seems about time to revive it. You have to fight these kooks with their own values.

They're acting like this a big deal, but letting her stay the rest of the school year - they know they're wrong and they just need a teacher in that classroom. She is right to stand up to them and keep her sign, it's a beautiful message.

https://www.westada.org/o/lcms/page/contact-us
I am proud of this teacher.
I fucking hate sharing a Country with Republikkkans.
